posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Many thanks, both - much appreciated.

It's given me another thought as well...If I was prepared to hang tough during pre-epic levels, and given that I only take 2 CoT BFs in epic levels to get that extra point in Wis (and I seem to have an aversion to Epic Toughness), it might well be worth going Paladin 11/ CoT 9 pre-epic so I could get both Toughness (to make up for the Con loss) and Cleave, as well as bringing 1 more BAB.

While one could argue that 4 levels of Rogue in epic levels might seem excessive, I still think they bring more (skills, Evasion, UD) than further levels in either Pally or CoT (essentially, just a few more HPs).

I'll go away and fiddle with it and make amendments in another colour (so this discussion doesn't appear nonsensical).

Thanks again.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just as an addendum to this, a little note about CoT that's easy to forget if you normally dump Charisma (as I do) and so only use CoT for bonus feats, saves, and maybe to avoid an xp pen with a melee class. It's also why it's worth losing being undispellable in this build for 15 levels of CoT.

It might only be me, but just in case it's not, it's worth remembering that, with positive Cha, Divine Wrath (at levels 5, 10, 15, etc) is really nice to have on board. It gives an attack and damage bonus and penetrates DR (albeit not often) that gets better every 5th level. And - and I didn't know this until I started looking at Paladin - CoT levels also count towards the damage inflicted in Smite Evil, which is really nice when dealing with bosses.

Anyway, I'm sure you lot all know this already, so I'll shut up.

EDIT: In the interests of honesty ), I've just moved WF to level 3 from level 1 (replaced with Cleave), because a rogue can't focus in longsword and nor can it focus in anything with a BAB of 0. Oops.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Here's another approach to a DEX Paladin: Paladin 24 / Monk 8 / Fighter 8.  You would get Monk attack progression on your dual kamas, Tumble and the use of Monk gear, and ES/EWS to help with damage output.  You get KD/IKD for free, but at the cost of having to wait until epic levels.  I decided on 8 Monk levels so you at least wouldn't have to wait until late epic levels for KD.  Paladin 24 would make your buffs undispellable.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
As for dexterity based paladins that Valerfor brought up:

I searched my folders and found one with builds from 2014-15 named "Stealthy paladin". All the builds there have charisma 8.
Most are dexers. Many of the builds have rogue levels and are dual wielding halflings with epic dodge and trap skills. AB varies a bit between 43 for the human ones to 47 for the most AB focused halfling, a Paladin 20, CoT 10/ SD 10. The halfling paladin/rogues have AB between 44 and 46.
They have names like "Holy agent", "Holy instigator" and "Holy commando"
So why do I post this? Just to point at a differenty way of using the paladin class.
